summary: The Service Contract Act provides pay and benefit standards for service workers—such as security guards and janitors—on covered federal contracts. The Department of Labor conducted more than 5,000 compliance investigations over 6 years and found violations of the Act leading to over $220 million in back wages for workers. Labor also determined that 60 contractors should be excluded from receiving new federal contracts for 3...
title: Federal Contracting: Opportunities Remain for Department of Labor to Improve Enforcement of Service Worker Wage Protections
